brief_summary.textblock:
A feasibility study for monitoring and recording gastrointestinal (GI) myoelectric activity
      in subjects with suspected or diagnosed irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and reports of GI
      pain and asymptomatic subjects without IBS and GI pain.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gastrointestinal Myoelectric Activity Protocol, the G-Tech EEnG Protocol

detailed_description.textblock:
This single-arm, non-randomized feasibility study has been designed to transcutaneously
      detect and monitor myoelectric intestinal signals temporally associated with the symptoms of
      patients who report pain and have suspected or diagnosed IBS, and in controls [subjects
      without suspected IBS or diagnosis of IBS and prior and/or current complaints of pain].

study_pop.textblock: Irritable bowel syndrome, functional bowel disorder.

link.description: Description of functional GI disorders, and detailed description of myoelectric science.

clinical_study.official_title: A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR MONITORING AND RECORDING GASTROINTESTINAL MYOELECTRIC ACTIVITY IN SUBJECTS WITH SUSPECTED OR DIAGNOSED IRRITABLE BOWEL SYNDROME (IBS) AND REPORTS OF GI PAIN AND ASYMPTOMATIC SUBJECTS WITHOUT IBS AND GI PAIN

overall_official.affiliation: G-Tech Chief Medical Officer and Medical Monitor

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
